website_summaries.verdict: While Dayton Audio's entry-level B452 bookshelf speaker's sound won't seduce too many audiophiles, it's remarkably satisfying for a speaker in its ultrabargain price class.
pros: Dayton Audio's diminutive B452 speaker sports a 4.5-inch woofer and even a 0.6-inch polycarbonate dome tweeter
Build quality standards are decent, there's not a lot of plastic, and the medium-density fiberboard cabinet and cloth grille are neatly finished
cons: Spring-clip wire connectors don't provide a secure grip on the cables

customer_reviews.title: For the price point these are very good speakers.
customer_reviews.text: For the price point these are very good speakers. Sound quality is good, bass is not muddy, highs come through well. With so many "sponsored" reviews I want to point out that I bought these at the selling price and have no association with manufacturer or distributor. This is a honest review.
customer_reviews.author: Erick R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: I paid $27 for these speakers and I would have paid $40. These are smaller bookshelf speakers, but the sound quality is very good even at higher volumes. I use these speakers for my home entertainment system, driven by an inexpensive 20w Lepai amplifier. Unless you have really high expectations, I doubt you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Eric V.

customer_reviews.title: I think these are great. I needed a compact speaker that still had ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I think these are great. I needed a compact speaker that still had decent sound. I really wanted the B652, but they were just a little too big for my space. Thankfully, Dayton Audio made a smaller version. My wife pulled into the garage and said she could hear them while she was still in her car! Plenty of volume, especially at this size and pricepoint. I was concerned my young daughter or dog might destroy these, but at this price, I won't be too upset if it happens. These are a great budget speaker and they still sound darn good.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small speakers for $35 shipped
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small speakers for $35 shipped. I wanted a small pair of speakers for the top of my bedroom dresser, mostly for listing to public radio. I use a vintage Sony STR VX22 with 35 WPC and they work well together. I had been using a refoamed pair of Boston Acoustics A60s but they're a little too big for my bedroom system so I got these.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Wind

customer_reviews.title: Dayton Audio makes very good speakers sounding speakers and amps for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 sets of these to use the speakers and crossovers in little Bluetooth speaker's that I built for my niece and two nephews. They absolutely love them. They sound very good for small speakers and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Keeney

customer_reviews.title: Decent speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: While these speakers are small and wouldnt fill a large space well, they work perfectly for smaller rooms or as auxilliary speakers on a larger system. Decent range and fit nicely on a bookcase or table. For the price, its hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Young

customer_reviews.title: Nice little speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are great speakers for the price. Good to have while you're saving up for bigger/better ones. I use these with a Pioneer receiver and find that I have to turn the bass down and the treble all the way up. Very clear vocals, but a little muddy on the lower end and other instruments. Would definitely recommend. Better than boombox sound.
customer_reviews.author: Violeta

customer_reviews.title: Sound great with a sub
customer_reviews.text: Using these speakers with a Topping TP 23 amp paired to my Mac over USB. Added custom 8 inch subwoofer I built using Dayton parts... Sounds better than the 3 way Technics I was using. They NEED a subwoofer. They sound anemic without one. I was expecting that I would have to replace the drivers but they sound good and they aren't broke-in yet
customer_reviews.author: macs_forever

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rear speakers for small home theater
customer_reviews.text: Replaced some aging Infinity bookshelves with these cuties. They're great for the back speakers in a small 5.1 setup. Sound is smooth, highs are clean. Of course there's no bass, that's not their job. Surprisingly good for the money so 5 stars for value.
customer_reviews.author: jdklmn

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Value
customer_reviews.text: Turned on to these spreakers by the Audiophiliac on youtube, I am quite simply astonished at the power and clarity of these bookshelf speakers. You will hear things you did not know were in the recording with these speakers! Enjoy,HZ.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got two sets of these. Snce the impedience ...
customer_reviews.text: I got two sets of these. Snce the impedience is rated as 6 Ohms I wired them in series fo get a 12 Ohm impedience, which, from some rersearch, I think is an easier load for the reciever to drive. I set them at at aboui a 30 degree angle ro each other for wider dispersion. I also think distortioin is lowered as each speaker has to play less loud then if I only had two. IF YOU DONT KNOW THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN WIRING IN SERIES AS OPPOSED TO PARALLEL STICK WITH ONE PAIR! Bargain speakers for soft music.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri Beljan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound in a small size
customer_reviews.text: I had fairly low expectations, but wanted something inexpensive to get my stereo up and running. Now that I have these installed, I don't think I'll be replacing them an time soon. The only place they fall short is in bass reproduction, and any other 4 1/2 inch speakers you get will have the same issue, so that's hardly a fault. The speakers also look great on the shelf, and are small enough to fit just about anywhere you could want them
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: Best sound ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best!!! I never thought l would find a speaker small enough to push such sound. Don't take my word " try them yourself. You will be suprise!!
customer_reviews.author: darrenwhite

customer_reviews.title: Do the job nicely, look decent
customer_reviews.text: Just needed a cheap set of speakers to replace my JBLs that were being used with a system in another room. These sound plenty good for your average listening. They look pretty good too and dont scream cheapness. I use these with a pioneer receiver in my manroom to play music to learn songs with on guitar, and happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Nino

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The speakers that came with my old stereo were huge. Way too big and I needed something smaller but still had good sound quality. These fit the bill. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are good little speakers that fit in small spaces. I use them for rear surround so not that much sound but I do notice them.
customer_reviews.author: OneTimez1

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the size
customer_reviews.text: Lots of options out there make it tough to choose. I'm very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: KSF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome speakers. Sounds much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Awesome speakers. Sounds much better than I expected, Great for a room stereo sound or for tv sound. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson47M

customer_reviews.title: Well built speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little speakers with well built cabinets that are heavy enough that the cat won't knock them off the shelf. If you like real music, these will work. If you want boom boom thump thump, you won't like them.
customer_reviews.author: Mordolo

customer_reviews.title: Nice bookshelf audio
customer_reviews.text: Great midsize speakers for rear channels in my home theatre setup. Replacing 20 year old speakers that developed distortion problems over the years. Excellent sound at moderate volume.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Orcutt

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers at Bargain price!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are fantastic. if you're looking for a quality, smaller, bookshelf speaker at a great price look no further. excellant quality, easy to hook-up, and sound terrific. could not be happier with purchase. arrived very fast after ordering. thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: James Kuether

customer_reviews.title: For the price can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: I was planning on changing the woofers, but there really is no need. On there own they sound great, but lack low end bass. I added an old DVC bass tube in parallel and am getting fantastic sound with a cheap amp.
customer_reviews.author: smitty

customer_reviews.title: Clear & clean lacks bass
customer_reviews.text: Good surround or bookshelf speakers but not really great for stand alone speakers. Needs a subwoofer to fill in the missing bass
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Quality speakers at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Speakers were perfect for hooking up to a TV with broken internal speakers. Considering the price point, these have clear audio and decent volume for their size. Would recommend getting them if you need cheap, quality speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: For the price, pretty good. Keep your expectations low. Like the price on these.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Dollar-for-Dollar, Very Hard to Beat
customer_reviews.text: Dollar for dollar, very hard to beat. Perfect for small spaces at lower volumes. I use my pair in my office paired to a cheap little amp coupled to my mobile via an 1/8" stereo jack. Very impressive low volume sound. I think I'll buy another pair for home use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sound is far better then I expected and the small woofers have a far greater excursion then I had anticipated so I found the base smooth and cleaner then expected for rear speakers in a small quad sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great for my usage.
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound for their size. They do buzz if you set the bass too heavy, but that's to be expected with a small speaker unless they're Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Mellies

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get an amp with this for they are very quiet for larger rooms.
customer_reviews.text: While they do have decent sound quality. They do seem to not get very loud. They also don't get very good lows. But good for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Ajeanpiere

customer_reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW Simply unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: At first I was very skeptical because of the low price and medium size of the speakers. I plugged them into a Sherwood Vintage stereo amplifier. And I'm just in SHock. in shock . Super quality, crazy bass. I'm really very pleased. Thank you, Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Lior V.

customer_reviews.title: Good Shelf Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These were a great choice for the bookshelf. Nice sound. Wife was happy. Made me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D Vaccaro

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great surround speaker for rear,lacks bass.do not recommend for mains.
customer_reviews.author: Digi man

customer_reviews.title: Dayton is always a friendly name for DIY enthusiast and ...
customer_reviews.text: Dayton is always a friendly name for DIY enthusiast and the ones who look for quality in affordable price. These bookshelf speakers are no different.
customer_reviews.author: JayDreamer

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely swear by these.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through about four sets of these, but mostly because I keep giving them away! They sound far better than their price would have you believe.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Trisler

customer_reviews.title: Super value here
customer_reviews.text: Super value here. Great sounding speakers that are far better then what is built into the TV. Adds some depth as well as loudness.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good and they have hook to hang on wall. These are great speakers,
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Peters

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed some auxiliary speakers for my 7.1 surround sound system. These speakers fit the bill perfectly. Couldn't be happier!!
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good sound from such small speakers
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good sound from such small speakers, have it in a 5.1 setup used as my surrounds along with dayton audio center and 6 1/2 fronts
customer_reviews.author: William Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Big sound, compact size, priced right can't go wron.
customer_reviews.text: Big sound from a compact size. Perfect for restoring my old stereo system.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Walker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound wonderful with my tube amplifier, a very true recreation of the music that I like!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great set of bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my daughter. I think they sound really good, especially for the price point. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Chad A. Gruender

customer_reviews.title: crisp highs and excellent mids. Great speaker
customer_reviews.text: I got these speakers for the SOLE purpose of using them as rear surround sound speakers. They have worked out perfectly so far. They supply clear, crisp highs and excellent rear mids. Great speaker. By-the-way, it's COMPLETELY unrealistic to expect great low frequency sound reproduction from a $29, 8 inch speaker with only a 4 inch woofer. Still, these speakers make a valiant and praise-worthy attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Boston

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal, good value
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers for the price, included wires are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: tjohnl

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for 39$
customer_reviews.text: Like: Small size, price, decent sound easy to hang it on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Yohanan Davidovich

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Hardly any bass but for the price very nice loud and crisp
customer_reviews.author: Tommy_21

customer_reviews.title: Amazballz!
customer_reviews.text: 20 minutes in... Blown away!!! Buy 2 pairs, stack them MTTM! Not my idea... Read about it on PE website. Very happy thus far!!!
customer_reviews.author: state2state

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: really good sound for the price, perfect for my work bench
customer_reviews.author: Spiker

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good for the price. Won't blow you away but sound is clear and nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: Great size and sound!
customer_reviews.text: I paired these with the 10" powered sub Dayton makes and powered them with a Lepai 2020. Plenty of power and they definitely sound better after a few "break in" days. They are perfect and very simple to wall mount and take up very little space. Overall worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Very good speaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good speaker for the price. It takes the amps just fine but needs more bass.If you have 4 speakers it works for the 2nd set and get a bassier 2 speakers for the other set.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good speakers for the price and they fit nicely on an already cluttered entertainment center.
customer_reviews.author: goodusedbooks

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price and pretty good sound
customer_reviews.text: Amazing price and pretty good sound. Larger than they might ideally be (esp. compared to Audioengine 2's), they are a great kitchen speaker when paired with the LP-2020A and my Amazon Echo Dot. Attaching them together bottom to bottom (like conjoined twins, sort of), attaching some sort of handle, and screwing the LP-2020A to the back is a little project I thought of which would make them more easily moved. Not sure how I'd attach them (sand and wood glue), nor what to use as a handle (decorative screws and scrap leather piece?)...
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: these are great bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: You know, for the price, these are great bookshelf speakers. I have them in my garage for when I'm working in there and I love them. Considering the size of the drivers, the sound is great. I'm extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F. Nava

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: sound great and a perfect little system to up my bedroom media center game.
customer_reviews.author: Will R Hargrave

customer_reviews.title: Fair performance speakers
customer_reviews.text: They are very well buit and the sound is good. But perhaps because I am using them as a substitute for the satellite speakers I had, they don't sound as good as I wanted them to sound. They lack the high frequency that is so necesary to get a full, pleasant sound experience. But they are good, and considering the price, you can't expect much more.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos E. Read

customer_reviews.title: For the money okay, not worth a cent more. Just needed faint music for a back room.
customer_reviews.text: For the money okay, not worth a cent more. Just needed faint music for a back room.

customer_reviews.title: Very very impressed with these little bad boys!
customer_reviews.text: Very very impressed with these little bad boys!!!! They blend in great with my set up.... All 10 of my speakers are Dayton Audio now!! Excellent product for an excellent price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money. all treble, hardly any ...
customer_reviews.text: not worth the money. all treble, hardly any mid and no bass. my records sound flat and weak through these speakers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Used to to replace some aging Onkyo surround sound speakers. Warm and crisp sound.
customer_reviews.author: Tim K

product_meta.title: Dayton Audio B452 4-1/2" 2-Way Bookshelf Speaker Pair
product_meta.description: Don't judge a speaker by its size! The Dayton Audio B452 4-1/2" bookshelf speaker is the smallest in the Dayton Audio family, but the sound is big. A newly-designed 4-1/2" polypropylene cone woofer with 4-layer voice coil achieves excellent balance and listenability when combined with the 5/8" Ferro fluid-cooled polycarbonate tweeter, for surprisingly rich, detailed sound from a small, affordable speaker. While cheap speakers use plastic enclosure parts to cut costs, the inexpensive B452 uses a sturdy wood-composite cabinet that minimizes resonance and enhances warmth without sacrificing clarity. The B452 bookshelf speaker fits into a space only 5.5" wide and less than 6" deep, making it the perfect choice for desktop listening, or compact surround speakers in a home theater surround-sound system. A built-in keyhole wall hanger bracket makes it a breeze to wall-mount the B452 in any desired location. For a room-filling listening experience with deeper bass that rivals larger full-sized speakers, the B452 speaker also pairs perfectly with any of the excellent Dayton Audio powered subwoofers. Anywhere you enjoy music, the balanced sound of the B452s add a new dimension of affordable enjoyment. Specifications: Woofer: 4-1/2" polypropylene cone with 4-layer voice coil Tweeter: 5/8" polycarbonate dome with Ferro fluid cooling Power handling: 30 watts RMS/60 watts max Impedance: 6 ohms Frequency response: 85-20,000 Hz Sensitivity: 84 dB 1W/1m Dimensions: 9.5" H x 5.5" W x 5.7" D.
feature_bullets: Compact, wall-mountable enclosure for unlimited applications
Perfect for home theater rears or stand-alone stereo use
4-1/2" woofer and polycarbonate tweeter for full-range sound
Dense, stable wood-composite cabinet ensures sonic warmth and richness
Black ebony pica vinyl finish blends into any décor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars127 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
